pages.text: A centrifugal pump is required to displace products from any apparatus that holds fluids to another. It's currently not possible to put 2 pumps in series, parallel pumping to increase flow rate is possible.$(br2)A motor must be present behind the pump for it to work. The motor can accept any type of power from the top.

The front of the pump is the "suck" side where it will suck liquids from all connected apparatus evenly. The top is the "press" side and will move the fluids to all apparatus that are connected here.$(br2)When an apparatus holds multiple fluids, it's seen as a mixture, so they will all be moved evenly in proportion.$(br2)The pump has a menu to set desired flowrate (0 - 50000) l/h.

$(#ff0000)$(l)Plant design challenge:$()$(br)Try designing your plant having all the pumps on the ground level next to each other. This is known as a pump gallery and allows for ease of access and repairability in real life. Have all the apparatus on floors above. This is how most plants in real life are built.
